title: Aastha Charitable and Welfare Society
detailsOfAchievement: The society works for the development of rural urban, tribal and slum area poor, helpless, deprived, old age people, women, widows, handicapped people of all communities without caste, creed, or sex for all round development, socio economic problem and problem of unemployment among the society. Society is working for the rehabilitation of the disabled person, disabled children and the geriatric people and manufacturing of artificial limb and orthotics materials. Society is distributing the calipers, wheel chair, tricycle and any assisting appliances according to the need of disabled. Society is also organising health check-up and awareness camp in different area both rural and urban and also educates the people for the national value of Gandhism and patriotism. Society runs the plantation programme for control pollution and conservation of the environment and aware the people to plant all types of tree and give knowledge of non-conventional energy solar energy, water energy, air energy and arrange solar energy aware the rural area people such time to time. Society will training, small scale industrial training cottage industrial training, khadi and village industrial training to the rural area women, unemployed youth, men, handicapped people, helpless people and widow women like sewing cutting, knitting, toy and doll making carpentry, radio and television making embroider candle making. Computer education and training centre, electronics training, hardware and software training accountancy training, pathology training, motor binding welding, fabrication, screen printing training for their economical development and self employment. Society is skilling the differently abled children. Society provide the relief measures among the affected area people during the natural calamities like flood, fire, famine, earth quake and provide medicine, food safe drinking water, sanitation and rehabilitation centre in the particular area.

detailsOfAchievement: Abhiyan has realized since its inception that women are the means to increased awareness generation in society. Women from these conservative â€œpurdahâ€ clad household s are today contesting elections and more than 200 have won. The women who won the election have also been provided training on leadership development and the functioning of the Panchayati Raj.The members of SHG groups in Abhiyanâ€™s contact are aware enough to send their children to schools. These women not only incorporate the immunization programs for their children but also motivate the women of whole village into vaccinating their children. These SHG members have also checked the manufacture, sale and consumption of liquor in their villages and this struggle is still ongoing. The women have also united against the atrocities on the women, which has resulted in the decrease in crimes against women in these villages. Above all, these women have availed the livelihood opportunities from the vocational trainings provided to them.Abhiyan has also helped around 550 persons out of the lowest income people or the people below poverty line in different districts of Bihar in taking the first step up out of poverty, by providing conditional seed capital and business training to the launch of a micro-enterprise. It is an effort to bring these people above poverty line. Abhiyan has expanded its work in more than 600 villages and 15 slums of Bihar and Jharkhand.At least 1800 Kosi flood affected families are in receipt of relief packages, meals, blankets, tents etc.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Create an end-to-end implementation framework for skill development, which provides opportunities for life-long learning. This includes: incorporation of skilling in the school curriculum, providing opportunities for quality long and short-term skill training, by providing gainful employment and ensuring career progression that meets the aspirations of trainees.

The objective of the scheme is to empower and instill confidence among minority women, including their neighbours from other communities living in the same village/locality, by providing knowledge, tools and techniques for interacting with Government systems, banks and other institutions at all levels.

The objective of this Skill Certification Scheme was to enable a large number of Indian youth to take up industry-relevant skill training that will help them in securing a better livelihood. A component for assessment and certification of individuals with prior learning experience or skills was also introduced under the Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL) component of the Scheme.

detailsOfAchievement: ADHAR IS A JOURNEY FROM â€œDEPENDENCE TO INDEPENDENCEâ€ & FROM â€œINDEPENDENCE TO INTERDEPENDENCEâ€ Adhar is a womenâ€™s Swawlambi cooperative society . The main objective of Adhar is to work for Socio-Economic upliftment of the Under Privileged people especially women & Adolescent Girls of Bihar. Adhar develop the skills of these women & Girls through Different types of Vocational & SKILL DEVELOPMENT Training such as, , Madhubani & Tikuli Craft, Aplic Work, Embroidery, Tailoring, House-Keeping, Fruits & Vegetable Preservation & NUTRITION Nutrition, Infant and Young Child Feeding, etc. and then help them to self employed or get a Jobs or creating markets for the products which are manufactured by them. Adhar is specialized in creating awareness among the people of weaker section especially for Adolescent Girl & women about the Health, Malnourishment amongst Women, Adolescent Girls & Children under 3years. Adhar is involved with different types of community work especially in the slum areas. It arranges for regular health checkup camps, free eye checkup & operations, water and sanitation drives etc. mainly for adolescent, women & children. Adhar is working closely with different governmental and donor agencies like Women Development Corporation, State Health Society, Bihar; Welfare Depptt. Govt of Bihar, Co-Operative Deptt. Bihar, Upendra Maharathi, UNICEF Bihar; ICDS Bihar, Food and Nutrition board, Ministry of Women and Child Development , Govt. of India; Micronutrient Initiative India,Power Grid Corporation of india, Bihar Chamber of Commerce and Industries, Bihar Industries Association, Deepayatan, etc. ONGOING TRAINING PROGRAM 1. detailsOfAchievement: Ahuti Natya Academy Begusarai is a socio art and culture group primarily involved in drama nukkad natak and stage shows in all districts of Bihar and at national arena as well it is a group of young and elderly people creative minded who have shown ways and created awareness among masses by touching different issues and spread message of social harmony and peace in the society SAMJHAUTA is the widely acclaimed drama of this academy which has been performed numerous times at different stages in the county and the same has been played in Mandal Art Theatre Nepal in the International Drama Festival at the same time academy also organises training programme for rural youth and nurture their talent and work for the upliftment of the society very soon academy is going to open and training centre in Begusarai for the facilitation of youth towards art and culture thereby changing face of the society

detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ Operation on street: - Where the street youth, orphans and child labour in the unorganized sectors will contact by our staffs and they will make sure that those street youth get a home and care and protection. â€¢ In the process there are can be several youth identified at the contact centres whose responses and coping machismos are totally inadequate and so self defeating that they needs more than reinforcements on the street itself. These youth needs more institutionalized care and follow up â€“ a place to come home, away from the harsh reality of the street, at least for some time. â€¢ Education for the street youth and orphans: Education can be one prime medium to come out of the social reality and make changes in their personnel life as well in the process they can make changes in the society. It requires a home and facilities to support educational need. The project will support such children, who canâ€™t go back to home or whose concept of family is missing. The project objective defines the process of their support. Our community involvement will look for their educational support and care. The project will address itself to the reality of the street youth of Siliguri and to the society which churns them out. â€¢ To contact and follow up as many street children youth as possible within their area and place of operation so as to identify their problems and needs and help them draw up personal goals in life. â€¢ To support those who can not come off the streets, so as to prevent them from becoming the others to achieve those aims, they set for themselves. â€¢ To from groups, associations and the like of street youth and working. â€¢ To provide night shelters, club rooms, hostels, training and study centres, youth village etc. which will support their rehabilitation. These would provide wholesome recreational. Cultural and social activates, counselling facilities, referral and advocacy services. â€¢ To plan and implement employment training, employment generation and employment betterment programmes and skill training. â€¢ To involve the society at large and youth in particular to work for and with the street youth and children, so us to evolve a movement that will create an awareness of the situation and about the structural causes as embedded in society through the media of press, publications, T.V. and other tools like internet and networking media. â€¢ To study and conduct research and documentation about the situation of such youth groups. â€¢ To collaborate with government and non-governmental agencies and persons working in the field or otherwise, to ensure the welfare of street youth. â€¢ To provide the street youth quality education through modern education process. â€¢ To help the street youth and children to come out of their difficult situation.
